white.$description: Pure white. Use for: light theme backgrounds, text on dark backgrounds, card surfaces. Contrast ratio with black: 21:1 (WCAG AAA). Avoid using directly - prefer semantic tokens like color.body or color.default.

black.$description: Pure black. Use for: dark theme text emphasis, high-contrast borders. Contrast ratio with white: 21:1 (WCAG AAA). Rarely used directly - prefer dark.9 for softer blacks or semantic color.text token.

transparent.$description: Fully transparent. Use for: invisible interactive areas, overlay starting states, clearfix backgrounds. CSS keyword value - works in all color contexts.

0.$description: Lightest dark - text color on dark backgrounds, disabled states on dark theme

1.$description: Light dark - secondary text on dark theme, subtle borders

2.$description: Mid-light dark - placeholder text on dark theme, icons

3.$description: Medium dark - dimmed text, decorative elements

4.$description: Mid dark - borders on dark theme, dividers

5.$description: Base dark - elevated surfaces on dark theme, cards

6.$description: Dark base - primary dark theme background, app shells

7.$description: Darker - alternative dark background, sidebar backgrounds

8.$description: Very dark - modal overlays on dark theme, deep shadows

9.$description: Darkest - near-black for maximum contrast elements

0.$description: Lightest gray - subtle backgrounds, hover states on white, zebra striping

1.$description: Light gray - input backgrounds, disabled backgrounds, table headers

2.$description: Mid-light gray - borders, dividers, inactive tabs

3.$description: Medium gray - placeholder text (use carefully - check contrast), icons

4.$description: Mid gray - secondary icons, chart gridlines

5.$description: Base gray - dimmed text, help text (4.5:1 on white = AA)

6.$description: Dark gray - secondary text (7:1 on white = AAA), labels

7.$description: Darker gray - primary text alternative, emphasis

8.$description: Very dark gray - high-emphasis text on light backgrounds

9.$description: Darkest gray - headings, maximum emphasis text

0.$description: Lightest red - error alert backgrounds, validation field backgrounds

1.$description: Light red - hover state for error backgrounds

3.$description: Medium red - icons on error backgrounds

4.$description: Mid red - error icons on white backgrounds

5.$description: Base red - primary destructive buttons, critical alerts

6.$description: Dark red - error text on white (6:1 contrast = AA), danger buttons

7.$description: Darker red - error text with maximum contrast (8:1 = AAA)

8.$description: Very dark red - text on light red backgrounds

9.$description: Darkest red - reserved for extreme emphasis

0.$description: Lightest pink - subtle highlights, badge backgrounds

1.$description: Light pink - hover states, selected rows

6.$description: Dark pink - text on light pink backgrounds (AA compliant)

8.$description: Very dark pink - text on light backgrounds

6.$description: Dark grape - text on light grape backgrounds
Dark violet - text on light backgrounds
Dark indigo - text on light backgrounds

0.$description: Lightest blue - primary light backgrounds, selected row highlights

1.$description: Light blue - hover backgrounds, info alert backgrounds

3.$description: Medium blue - icons on light backgrounds

4.$description: Mid blue - primary buttons on dark theme, links on dark

5.$description: Base blue - primary buttons, links (light theme)

6.$description: Dark blue - primary brand color, main CTAs, navigation active states

7.$description: Darker blue - pressed states, text on light blue backgrounds

8.$description: Very dark blue - high contrast text

9.$description: Darkest blue - maximum emphasis, dark accents

6.$description: Dark cyan - text on light backgrounds
Dark teal - text on light backgrounds

0.$description: Lightest green - success alert backgrounds, positive feedback areas

1.$description: Light green - hover state for success backgrounds

2.$description: Mid-light green - progress indicators, completion bars

3.$description: Medium green - success icons on light backgrounds

4.$description: Mid green - success badges, online indicators

5.$description: Base green - primary success buttons, checkmarks

6.$description: Dark green - success text on white (5:1 contrast = AA)

7.$description: Darker green - success text with maximum contrast

8.$description: Very dark green - text on light green backgrounds

6.$description: Dark lime - text on light backgrounds

0.$description: Lightest yellow - warning backgrounds (must use dark text)

1.$description: Light yellow - hover state for warning backgrounds

2.$description: Mid-light yellow - caution icons with dark stroke

3.$description: Medium yellow - warning badges (ensure dark text)

5.$description: Base yellow - rarely used for text

6.$description: Dark yellow - minimum for text (check contrast)

7.$description: Darker yellow - warning text on light backgrounds (4.5:1)

8.$description: Very dark yellow - safe for body text on white

6.$description: Dark orange - text on light backgrounds

text.$description: Primary text color (#FFFFFF in dark theme). Use for: headings, body text, labels, primary content. HIGHEST contrast against dark body background. WCAG AAA compliant. Common in: Typography, labels, form field values, card content, navigation text.

body.$description: Body/page background color (darkest gray in dark theme). Use for: main page background, app shell, deepest surface layer. FOUNDATIONAL surface color - everything else layers on top with progressively lighter surfaces. Common in: App shell background, page wrapper, root container.

bright.$description: Bright/emphasis text color. In dark theme, same as text (white). Use for: highest emphasis content, key figures, critical information, visual hierarchy peaks. Provides flexibility for themes where bright differs from text. Common in: Dashboard metrics, highlighted text, key stats.

error.$description: Error state text color (red.4 - lighter red for dark theme). Adjusted lighter than light theme to maintain contrast on dark backgrounds. Use for: error messages, validation failures, destructive action warnings, critical alerts. ACCESSIBILITY: Combine with an icon - don't rely on color alone to convey errors. Common in: Form validation errors, Alert (error variant), Toast (error), inline error messages.

placeholder.$description: Placeholder text color (gray.5 for dark theme). Use for: input placeholder text, empty state hints, secondary guidance text. CAUTION: Not suitable for essential information - only use for hints that enhance, not provide, meaning. Common in: Input placeholders, Select placeholder, search hints, empty state descriptions.

anchor.$description: Anchor/link text color (blue.4 - lighter blue for dark theme). Adjusted lighter to maintain contrast on dark backgrounds. Use for: hyperlinks, clickable text, text buttons, navigation links. Must be distinguishable from surrounding text. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure 3:1 contrast against non-link text per WCAG 1.4.1. Common in: Anchor elements, text-style buttons, breadcrumb links, inline navigation.

default.$description: Default surface/background color for components (dark.7 - elevated surface). Slightly lighter than body to create visual hierarchy. Use for: button backgrounds, input backgrounds, card surfaces, component base layer. Common in: Button (default variant), Input background, Card surface, Dropdown trigger, Tab panels.

default-hover.$description: Default hover background color (dark.6 - lighter surface). Use for: hover states on default surfaces, interactive row highlights, button hover feedback. In dark theme, hover states get LIGHTER (opposite of light theme). Common in: Button:hover, Table row:hover, List item:hover, Menu item:hover, Dropdown option:hover.

default-color.$description: Default text color for default-background components. Use for: button text, input text, component labels. Pairs with 'default' background for proper contrast. Common in: Button text, Input value, Tab label, Menu item text, Badge text.

default-border.$description: Default border color (dark.4 - medium dark gray). Use for: input borders, card boundaries, component outlines, dividers. Provides subtle definition on dark surfaces. Common in: Input border, Card border, Table cell borders, Divider lines, Tab container borders.

dimmed.$description: Dimmed/muted text color (gray.5). Use for: secondary text, metadata, timestamps, captions, helper text, de-emphasized content. Lower contrast than primary text to establish visual hierarchy. Common in: Timestamps, bylines, helper text, secondary labels, metadata.

disabled.$description: Disabled element background color (dark.6). Use for: disabled button backgrounds, inactive input backgrounds, unavailable component surfaces. Visually indicates non-interactivity through muted appearance. ACCESSIBILITY: Use with aria-disabled='true'. Color alone is not sufficient - combine with disabled-color text. Common in: Button:disabled background, Input:disabled background, disabled toggle/switch.

disabled-color.$description: Disabled element text color (gray.6). Use for: disabled button text, inactive labels, unavailable option text. Reduced contrast indicates non-interactivity. ACCESSIBILITY: Disabled elements are exempt from WCAG contrast requirements BUT should still be perceivable. Pairs with 'disabled' background. Common in: Button:disabled text, Select:disabled option, disabled form label.

disabled-border.$description: Disabled element border color (dark.5). Use for: disabled input borders, inactive component outlines. Completes the disabled state trio (disabled, disabled-color, disabled-border). Common in: Input:disabled border, Button:disabled outline, disabled Card border.

0.$description: Primary shade 0 - lightest. In dark theme, rarely used as background (too light). May be used for: light text accents, decorative elements, inverted contexts. Common in: Light accents on dark, decorative elements.

1.$description: Primary shade 1. In dark theme, may appear as very light accent. Use for: subtle light accents, high-contrast elements against dark backgrounds. Common in: Decorative light accents.

2.$description: Primary shade 2. Use for: lighter accents, progress bar fills on dark backgrounds, light indicators. Common in: Progress indicators, decorative elements.

3.$description: Primary shade 3. Use for: medium-light accents, badges, icons that need to stand out on dark backgrounds. Common in: Badge backgrounds, icon fills.

4.$description: Primary shade 4 - PRIMARY INTERACTIVE FOR DARK THEME. Main shade for buttons and interactive elements in dark theme. Use for: primary buttons, links, active states. Lighter than light theme's shade 6 for proper contrast on dark backgrounds. Common in: Button (primary), Anchor, Checkbox:checked, Radio:selected.

5.$description: Primary shade 5. Use for: primary button hover in dark theme, focus rings, medium emphasis accents. Common in: Button (primary):hover, Focus ring color, interactive element outlines.

6.$description: Primary shade 6. In dark theme, used for: hover states, active indicators, medium-dark accents. Still visible but darker than the interactive shade. Common in: Active states, hover feedback on lighter elements.

7.$description: Primary shade 7. Use for: subtle backgrounds on dark surfaces, 'light' variant hover in dark theme, dark accents. Common in: Subtle primary backgrounds, light variant hover states.

8.$description: Primary shade 8. Use for: 'light' variant backgrounds in dark theme (primary.light), very subtle primary tinting on dark surfaces. Near-black with primary tint. Common in: Primary light background, subtle surface tinting.

9.$description: Primary shade 9 - darkest primary. In dark theme, nearly black. Use for: extremely subtle backgrounds, near-invisible primary tints, deep surface colors. Common in: Very subtle surface variations.

filled.$description: Primary filled background color (shade 4 in dark theme - lighter than light theme's shade 6). Use for: primary button backgrounds, selected toggles, active tabs, main CTAs. This is the HERO primary color - highest brand visibility. ACCESSIBILITY: Use with primary.contrast text for proper contrast. Common in: Button (primary), active Tab, selected Checkbox/Radio, primary Badge.

filled-hover.$description: Primary filled hover state background (shade 5 in dark theme). Use for: primary button hover, active element hover feedback. In dark theme, filled hover gets LIGHTER (toward white). Common in: Button (primary):hover, active Tab:hover, primary action hover states.

light.$description: Primary light/subtle background color (shade 8 in dark theme - darkened blue). Use for: subtle primary emphasis, light variant buttons, selected row backgrounds, info alerts. On dark backgrounds, 'light' variant uses darker shades. Common in: Button (primary light variant), selected Table row, Alert (info), Tag/Chip (primary).

light-hover.$description: Primary light hover state background (shade 7 in dark theme). Use for: light primary button hover, selected row hover. In dark theme, light variant hovers get LIGHTER. Common in: Button (primary light):hover, selected row:hover.

light-color.$description: Text color for use ON primary.light backgrounds (shade 4 in dark theme). Use for: text in light primary buttons, labels in info alerts, icons on light primary surfaces. Ensures readable contrast on subtle primary backgrounds. Common in: Button (primary light) text, Alert (info) text, light primary Badge text.

contrast.$description: Contrast text color for use ON primary.filled backgrounds. White in both themes. Use for: primary button text, icons on primary backgrounds, text overlaid on brand colors. CRITICAL for accessibility - ensures readable text on primary surfaces. Common in: Button (primary) text/icon, primary Badge text, primary Chip text.

0.$description: Fully transparent (0%). Use for: hidden elements, animation start states, invisible interactive areas. Element is invisible but may still be interactive. CSS: opacity: 0; visibility: hidden for truly hidden.

5.$description: 5% opacity - barely visible. Use for: extremely subtle hover states, ghost backgrounds, near-invisible separators. Only visible against high-contrast backgrounds.

10.$description: 10% opacity - subtle transparency. Use for: light hover backgrounds, subtle shadows, faint overlays. Minimally perceptible change.

20.$description: 20% opacity - light transparency. Use for: hover states, light overlays, muted backgrounds. Noticeable but unobtrusive.

25.$description: 25% opacity - quarter visible. Use for: skeleton loading states, light dimming, subtle backgrounds. Common for placeholder content.

30.$description: 30% opacity - moderate transparency. Use for: image overlays, text shadows, moderate dimming. Visible but allows content behind to show clearly.

40.$description: 40% opacity - semi-transparent. Use for: medium overlays, watermarks, partially hidden content. Balanced visibility.

50.$description: 50% opacity - half visible. Use for: disabled elements (semantic alias: 'disabled'), balanced overlays, de-emphasized content. CAUTION: May not meet contrast requirements for text.

60.$description: 60% opacity - mostly visible. Use for: modal backdrops (semantic alias: 'overlay'), dimmed backgrounds, focus-drawing overlays. Content behind is visible but de-emphasized.

70.$description: 70% opacity - high visibility. Use for: heavy overlays, strong dimming, de-emphasized backgrounds. Most content visible but clearly secondary.

75.$description: 75% opacity - three-quarters visible. Use for: dark overlays, strong backgrounds, significant dimming. Mostly solid with hint of transparency.

80.$description: 80% opacity - mostly solid. Use for: nearly-opaque overlays, frosted glass effects (with backdrop-filter), heavy backgrounds.

90.$description: 90% opacity - nearly solid. Use for: subtle transparency effects, slight see-through, glass-like surfaces. Almost indistinguishable from solid.

100.$description: Fully opaque (100%). Use for: solid elements, removing inherited transparency, default element state. CSS: opacity: 1; (default browser value).

disabled.$description: Disabled element opacity (50%). SEMANTIC alias for opacity.50. Use for: disabled buttons, inactive controls, unavailable options. Universally recognized as 'inactive'. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure disabled elements are still perceivable and their disabled state is communicated via aria-disabled.

overlay.$description: Modal overlay opacity (60%). SEMANTIC alias for opacity.60. Use for: modal backdrops, lightbox backgrounds, focus-drawing overlays. Dims background while keeping it visible for context. Common in: Modal backdrop, Drawer overlay, image lightbox backgrounds.

scale.$description: Global scale factor for Mantine components. 1 = default size, 0.8 = 80% size, 1.2 = 120% size.

cursorType.$description: Cursor style for interactive elements. 'pointer' for clickable, 'default' for standard.

webkitFontSmoothing.$description: WebKit font smoothing. 'antialiased' for crisp text on macOS/iOS.

mozFontSmoothing.$description: Mozilla font smoothing. 'grayscale' for crisp text on Firefox.

headingFontWeight.$description: Default font weight for all headings (h1-h6).

headingTextWrap.$description: Text wrapping behavior for headings. 'wrap' allows line breaks, 'balance' balances lines.

radiusDefault.$description: Default border radius when no size is specified. References radius.sm token.

text.$description: Text color for dark theme elements (lighter for visibility)

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for dark filled elements (lighter)

light.$description: Light variant of dark color for dark theme

light-hover.$description: Hover state for dark light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for dark light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for dark outline elements

text.$description: Text color for gray theme elements (lighter for dark theme)

filled-hover.$description: Hover state for gray filled elements

light.$description: Light variant of gray color for dark theme

light-hover.$description: Hover state for gray light elements

light-color.$description: Text color for gray light elements

outline-hover.$description: Hover state for gray outline elements

light-hover.$description: Hover state for red light elements
